name: Prone Assisted Neck Bridge
steps: Place a yoga or exercise mat on the floor for head padding.
Position the top of your head on the floor with your arms bent at the elbows, hands on the ground by both sides of your head, supporting your upper body.
Support your lower body by balancing on the balls of your toes.
Hinge at the hips to maintain a neutral spine throughout the movement.
Hold the bridge position for up to 8 seconds or as long as comfortable.
Lower your heels back down to the floor and extend your arms at the elbows to finish one repetition.
Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: One-Arm Hands-and-Knees Spine Twist
steps: Kneel down and sit back onto your heels.
Place both elbows on the ground in front of you.
Raise one arm and place your hand behind your head.
Rotate your upper body towards the side with the raised arm, looking up.
Hold the stretch for 5 seconds.
Slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat the stretch for the desired number of repetitions on each side.

name: One-Leg Hip Dip
steps: Stand on one leg with the other leg bent and lifted off the ground.
Keep the knee of the standing leg straight and your spine neutral.
Tilt your hips by lowering the side with the lifted leg towards the ground slowly.
Lift the hip of the suspended leg towards the ceiling by engaging the hip muscles.
Avoid leaning your torso to keep the spine neutral throughout the movement.
Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions and then switch to the other leg.

name: One-Leg Wide Lunge
steps: Start in a plank or push-up position with both hands on the floor.
Step one foot forward, placing it just outside your hand on the same side.
Keep the back leg extended straight behind you with toes tucked under.
Lower your hips towards the floor to stretch the front leg’s hamstrings and glutes. Your back knee may touch the floor.
Push your hips forward to stretch the hip flexors of the back leg.
Hold the stretch for the desired time and switch to the other side.

name: One-Leg Rock-Paper-Scissor Toes
steps: Sit on a chair or on the floor. Raise one foot off the floor, holding the leg up by the raised knee.
Curl all toes to create the ‘rock’ position.
Return to neutral with toes relaxed.
Spread all toes apart into the ‘paper’ position.
Extend the big toe while keeping other toes curled for the ‘scissors’ position part one.
Curl the big toe and extend the other four toes for the ‘scissors’ position part two.
Continue alternating between the ‘rock’, ‘paper’, and both ‘scissors’ positions for the desired number of repetitions before switching to the other side.

name: One-Leg Seated Knee-to-Chest – Foam Roller
steps: Sit on the floor and place a foam roller behind your lower back.
Lean back slowly onto the foam roller, positioning it under your lumbar spine.
Hug one knee to your chest, keeping the other leg straight on the floor to avoid arching your lower back.
Find a tender spot and hold gentle pressure on it for the desired time. Hold each position instead of rolling.
Switch sides and hold the stretch for the same amount of time on the other leg.

name: Calf Massage – Lacrosse Ball
steps: Sit on the floor and place a massage ball under your calf muscle.
Apply gentle pressure by pressing your leg down onto the ball.
Slowly flex your foot upward (dorsiflex) to stretch the calf while keeping pressure on the ball.
Then point your foot downward (plantarflex) to massage the calf.
Repeat the flexing and pointing movement slowly to massage the muscle.
Hold the massage for the desired time and switch to the other calf if needed.
notes: Increase the pressure of your calf on the ball by adding your other leg's ankle onto the pressured leg's shin to press down.

name: One-Arm Wall Push Front Bend
steps: Stand facing a wall and place one hand flat against it at shoulder height.
Step back slightly and bend forward at the hips, keeping your arm straight and pressed into the wall.
Lift your arm upward along the wall to increase the stretch in the front of your shoulder.
Keep your back flat and your core engaged to avoid arching.
Hold the stretch for the desired time and switch to the other side.

name: One-Leg Lying Ankle Nerve Floss
steps: Lie on your back on a padded surface with one thigh lifted to 90 degrees and supported by both both hands interlaced on the hamstring.
Keep the raised knee as straight as possible without causing nerve tension.
Keep the other leg straight and flat on the floor.
Simultaneously lift your head off the ground and at your chest while pointing your toes away from you (plantarflex).
Then, lower your head and look towards the ceiling while pulling your raised foot toward you (dorsiflex).
Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions then switch sides.

name: One-Leg Three-Point Lunge
steps: Stand with the right leg planted firmly on the ground.
Visualize standing in the center of a triangle with one point in front of you and two behind.
Bend the right knee slightly and lunge the left leg back to the rear-left triangle point. Tap the rear-left triangle point with your left toes without putting weight on that foot.
Return to standing position.
Bend the right knee and gently tap the floor front triangle point with your left heel.
Return to standing position.

Bend the right knee again and reach the left leg back to the rear-right triangle point. Your left leg will cross behind your right. Your left knee will drop nearly to the floor in a "curtsy". Touch the rear-right triangle point with your toes without putting weight on that foot.
Return to standing position. This is one repetition.
Continue repeating the movement for the desired number of repetitions then switch target legs.

name: Lying Overhead Shoulder Rotation – Dowel
steps: Lie on your back holding a dowel with both hands above your chest, hands shoulder-width apart, with straight arms.
Lower the dowel over over your head by flexing your shoulders, keeping arms straight.
Hold the end range stretch for the desired amount of time.

name: Neck Twist – Lacrosse Ball
steps: Place a massage or lacrosse ball against the front and outer side of your neck.
Use your hand to gently compress the ball into the muscles.
Slowly rotate your head to the opposite side to increase the stretch on the neck.
Use small movements to massage the muscle group while maintaining gentle pressure.
Hold the massage and stretch for the desired time and switch to the other side.

name: Alternating Lying Chin Tuck Neck Twist
steps: Lie on your back with your forehead and chin parallel to the floor.
Tuck your chin in gently without lifting your head.
Rotate your neck slowly all the way to one side.
Return your head to center and rest briefly.
Rotate your neck all the way to the opposite side.
Return your head to center to complete one repetition.
Alternate the starting side with each new set.
Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: One-Leg Seated Hip Flexor Hold
steps: Sit on a comfortable surface with a neutral spine.
Lift one knee as high as possible without arching or rounding your back.
Place both hands on the lifted thigh and push down firmly while resisting the movement with your hip muscles.
Maintain the contraction at the desired intensity for the set duration.
Hold the contraction for the desired time and switch to the other side.

name: One-Arm Lying Spine Twist – Yoga Block
steps: Lie on your side with your top leg supported by a yoga block or foam roller.
Extend both arms straight in front of you, palms together.
Lift your top arm up towards the ceiling while keeping your legs stable. Your gaze should follow the top arm while it travels.
Rotate your upper body, moving your top arm behind your back, face twisted towards the top arm, without lifting your leg off the support.
Hold the pose for the desired amount of time before repeating the exercise on the other side.

name: One-Arm Side Shoulder Pull – Band
steps: Anchor one end of a thick strength band to a stable pull-up bar or object.
Loop the free end of the band around your wrist with your arm raised to shoulder height beside you.
Lean your body away from the band, moving to the opposite side while keeping your arm raised.
Relax your shoulder muscles and let gravity pull your arm gently to stretch the shoulder.
Hold the stretch for the desired time and switch to the other side.

name: One-Leg Assisted Side Lunge
steps: Stand next to a chair, wall, or stable counter and hold it for support.
Bend the knee of the leg closest to the support, ensuring it stays aligned with the middle of your foot.
Step the other leg out to the side, keeping your leg straight, foot flat, and toes pointing forward.
Use your support to help balance as you lower into the side lunge. Move your hips towards the support, stretching your inner thigh on your straight leg.
Push through the bent leg to return to standing, extending your knee.
Repeat the stretch for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other side.

name: Shoulder Blade Push Up
steps: Start in a high plank position with your arms straight and hands under your shoulders.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together, pulling them back toward each other.
Push your shoulder blades forward as far as possible, spreading them apart.
Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
notes: Keep your elbows straight and upper back flat throughout the exercise. Modify by doing the exercise from your knees if the high plank is too challenging.

name: Lying Hamstring Bridge With Adductor Squeeze – Yoga Block
steps: Lie on your back on a padded surface with a yoga block or foam roller between your knees.
Squeeze the block with your inner thighs to engage your hip adductors.
Bend your knees to more than 90 degrees and keep your feet hip-distance apart.
Brace your core to keep a neutral spine.
Drive your heels into the ground and lift your hips until your thighs align with your torso.
Hold the lift for the desired time or lower your hips back down to the floor to complete one repetition.
Repeat the exercise for the desired time or number of repetitions.

name: One-Leg Kick Back Hold – Band
steps: Loop a band around both ankles, keeping feet hip-width apart.
Stand upright and engage your core to stabilize your body.
Slowly extend one leg backward by kicking your foot behind you, keeping your knee straight.
Hold the extended position, squeezing your glutes for up to 7 seconds.
Return your leg to the starting neutral position with control.
Repeat the stretch for the desired number of repetitions before switching to the other leg.

name: Heel Raise Hold
steps: Stand with your feet flat on the ground, shoulder-width apart.
Shift your weight evenly across the balls of all your toes.
Slowly raise your heels about 1 inch (2.5 cm) off the ground.
Keep your toes and balls of your feet firmly planted and stable.
Hold this raised position for 15-30 seconds.
Lower your heels back down with control.
Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name: One-Leg Lying Outer Hip Twist
steps: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Cross one ankle over the opposite thigh just above the knee.
Keep your upper back and shoulders pressed into the floor.
Slowly rotate your hips away from the crossed leg, letting the bottom thigh fall toward the floor.
Use the weight of the crossed leg to deepen the stretch in your outer hip.
Hold the stretch for the desired time and switch to the other side.

name: One-Leg Lying Outer Thigh Contraction – Band
steps: Anchor a ~100 lbs pull-up assist band to a stable object so that the free end hangs at about hip height.
Loop your ankle through the free end of the band.
Lie on your back on a padded surface with the band anchor opposite the target hip.
Allow the band to gently pull your hip outward until you feel a light stretch on the outer hip.
Hold the stretch for 5-7 seconds while relaxing into the band’s pull.
Contract the hip muscles to resist the band’s pull and hold the contraction for 5-7 seconds.
Release the contraction and return to the stretch position to complete one repetition.
Continue repetitions for the desired amount of time.

name: One-Arm Rotator Cuff Backwards Wall Press – Yoga Block
steps: Stand with your back against a wall and raise your arm to shoulder height.
Bend your elbow to 90 degrees, so that your hand points to the ceiling.
Hold a yoga block or foam roller with the back of your raised hand, pressing it against the wall.
Push your hand into the block without moving your arm or elbow.
Hold the stretch for the desired time then switch to the other side.

name: One-Leg Foot Plank – Yoga Block
steps: Place two yoga blocks on the floor and stand so one foot is supported on the blocks at the heel and toes.
Shift your weight onto the supported foot.
Allow the ball of your big toe to drop below the level of the yoga block.
Activate the muscles in your foot to lift the ball of your big toe back to a neutral position.
Hold the lifted position for 5 to 7 seconds.
Rest for the same amount of time.
Continue repetitions for the desired amount of time.

name: One-Arm Rotator Cuff Forward Wall Press – Yoga Block
steps: Stand with your chest against a wall and raise your arm to shoulder height.
Bend your elbow to 90 degrees, so that your hand points to the ceiling.
Hold a yoga block or foam roller with the front of your raised hand, pressing it against the wall.
Push your hand into the block without moving your arm or elbow.
Hold the stretch for the desired time then switch to the other side.

name: One-Arm Lunging Spinal Wall Twist
steps: Start in a split squat position with your front leg against the wall, foot flat on the ground. Place your back leg's knee and toes on the ground.
Raise the arm on the same side as your front leg to 90 degrees in front of you. Keep the back of your hand and forearm in contact with the wall.
Rotate your torso slowly away from the front leg side, reaching your other arm back to touch the back of that hand to the wall behind you.
Keep your hips facing forward and chest open as you rotate.
Hold the stretch for the desired time and switch to the other side.

name: Alternating Sit-to-Rise Cossack Squat
steps: Sit with your legs in front of you, shoulder-width apart.
While remaining seated, lift one leg and rotate it outwards towards a 90-degree angle with the stationary leg.
As you rotate the leg, bend your knee to bring your foot flat on the ground and close to your glute as possible.
Perform a Cossack squat by pushing on the bent and straight legs to stand upright in a wide-leg stance.
Push through the wide-leg stance to continue to lower yourself to a Cossack squat on the other side. Reversing the movement all the way to sit on the floor.
Lift the bent knee, rotate and straighten it to sit with your legs in front of you. You should be in the same position as when you first started the exercise, but facing the opposite direction.
Continue alternating the movement on each side for the desired amount of time.

name: One-Leg Seated Hamstring Roll – Foam Roller
steps: Sit on the floor and place a foam roller under one hamstring while placing the other leg's foot flat on the ground for stability.
Lean forward slightly to engage and stretch your hamstring.
Roll your leg back and forth on the foam roller to find tender spots.
When you find a tender spot, hold the position.
Hold the stretch for the desired time, then move to another spot or switch legs.

name: One-Leg Elevated Pidgeon Stretch
steps: Place your front leg on an elevated surface, such as a bench, with the shin flat on the surface and the knee rotated outward from your hip.
Extend your back leg straight behind you on the ground.
Drop your front hip down toward the ground.
Support your upper body with your hands on the ground to maintain balance.
Keep your spine neutral and avoid leaning forward or back.
Take deep breaths, holding the stretch for the desired time, and switch sides.

name: One-Arm Shoulder-Height Bicep Stretch
steps: Raise one arm to shoulder height next to your body.
Rotate your wrist so your palm faces down.
Place your palm firmly against a doorframe, squat rack, or wall.
Twist your body away from your anchored arm to stretch your biceps.
Hold the stretch for the desired time and switch to the other side.

name: Hip Hinge – Dowel
steps: Place a dowel along your back, anchoring it against your head, between your shoulder blades, and on your tailbone.
Stand with feet hip-width apart and keep a slight bend in your knees.
Hinge forward at the hips, pushing your butt back while maintaining contact of the dowel at all three points.
Avoid rounding your back or letting the dowel lose contact with your head, upper back, or tailbone.
Stand back up straight, keeping the dowel in position.
Continue repetitions for the desired amount of time.

name: Low Arms Rotator Cuff Forward Wall Press
steps: Stand facing a wall with your elbows straight and aligned below your shoulders.
Place your palms on the wall with fingers pointing forward.
Press your palms into the wall, gradually increasing the force over 3 seconds.
Hold the maximal push for 5-7 seconds without moving your elbows.
Slowly decrease the pressure back to rest over 3 seconds.
Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of time.
